revision.text:
{{For|the 1981 "President Elect" computer game|President Elect (computer game)}} {{globalize/USA|date = June 2011}} {{unreferenced|date = June 2011}} An '''-elect''' is a [[political]] candidate who has been [[election|elected]] to an office but who has not yet been [[Inauguration|sworn in]] or officially taken office. These may include an incoming [[president-elect of the United States|president]], senator, representative, governor and mayor.
Analogously, the term "designate" (e.g. [[Prime Minister-designate]]) is used in systems without direct elections of executive politicians, such as in [[parliamentary system]]s.
==Title== In the [[United States]], a person elected to office at the state or federal levels, and sometimes by custom at local levels, is given the courtesy style of the ''[[Honorable]]'' (abbreviated to ''Hon.'' or ''Hon'ble'').
==See also== *[[President-elect of the United States]]
